subproject.description:
Taking into consideration that as much as 25% of Mozambique’s population faces a high mortality risk from natural hazards, and that it ranks as the second most geographically exposed country in Africa, the overall goal of the project is to strengthen national capacities at all levels to reduce the risk of disasters and mitigate their impacts on the vulnerable populations in the country. 
To achieve this, the project builds on the National Master Plan for Disaster Risk Reduction which aims at strengthening institutional frameworks and systems for preparedness, response and disaster risk reduction at all levels within an overall vulnerability reduction perspective.
donor_long: UNDP AS AA FOR JP PASS THROUGH
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Disaster Risk Reduction
